    Generating Sample Covariance Matrices from the Wishart Distribution

    Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan

    rvcov_wishart.Rmd
    library(multiNorm)

    The multivariate normal distribution is given by

    \[\begin{equation} \mathbf{x} \sim \mathcal{N}_{k} \left( \boldsymbol{\mu}, \boldsymbol{\Sigma} \right) \label{eq:multiNorm-mvn} \end{equation}\]

    where \(\mathbf{x} = \left\{ X_1, \dots, X_k \right\}^{\prime}\) is a vector of random variables, \(\boldsymbol{\mu}\) is a \(k \times 1\) vector of means of the random variables, and \(\boldsymbol{\Sigma}\) is a \(k \times k\) matrix of variances on the diagonals and covariances on the off-diagonals of the random variables.

    The Wishart distribution is given by

    \[\begin{equation} \mathcal{W}_{k} \left( \mathbf{V}, n - 1 \right) \label{eq:multiNorm-wishart} \end{equation}\]

    where \(\mathbf{V}\) is a \(k \times k\) positive definite matrix, and \(n - 1\) is the degrees of freedom.

    When data is randomly sampled from the multivariate normal distribution, the distribution of the unbiased sample covariance matrix \(S_{n - 1}\), where \(n\) is the sample size and \(n - 1\) is the degrees of freedom, is given by

    \[\begin{equation} \left( n - 1 \right) S_{n - 1} \sim \mathcal{W} \left( \boldsymbol{\Sigma}, n - 1 \right) \label{eq:multiNorm-vcov-wishart} \end{equation}\]

    Sample covariances can be generated from the Wishart distribution using

    \[\begin{equation} \left( n - 1 \right)^{-1} \mathcal{W} \left( \boldsymbol{\Sigma}, n - 1 \right) \label{eq:multiNorm-vcov-inv-wishart} \end{equation}\]

    set.seed(42)
n_i <- 1000
df_i <- n_i - 1
rcap_i <- 10
k_i <- sample(x = 2:10, size = 1)
sigmacap_i <- toeplitz((k_i:1) / k_i)
vech_i <- vech(sigmacap_i)
sigmacap_i
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]  1.0  0.5
#> [2,]  0.5  1.0
vech_i
#> [1] 1.0 0.5 1.0
df_i
#> [1] 999

    rvcov_wishart

    data_i <- rvcov_wishart(
  rcap = rcap_i,
  sigmacap = sigmacap_i,
  df = df_i,
  list = TRUE
)
data_i
#> [[1]]
#>           [,1]      [,2]
#> [1,] 1.0686256 0.5356691

    data_i <- rvcov_wishart(
  rcap = rcap_i,
  sigmacap = sigmacap_i,
  df = df_i,
  list = FALSE,
  vec = TRUE
)
data_i

    rvcov_wishart_of_vechsigmacap

    data_i <- rvcov_wishart_of_vechsigmacap(
  rcap = rcap_i,
  x = vech_i,
  df = df_i
)
data_i
